meanings.definition: An ugly old woman, especially a witch or sorceress.
meanings.sent1: The children were scared of the hags in the spooky forest.
meanings.sent2: The fairy tale featured a wicked hag who cast spells on the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The hags in the story brewed potions in their cauldrons.
meanings.sent4: The old hag's cackle echoed through the haunted house.
meanings.sent5: The hag's twisted face and crooked nose made her a memorable character.

meanings.definition: To harass, annoy, or torment persistently.
meanings.sent1: The persistent salesperson would hag me every day to buy their product.
meanings.sent2: Stop trying to hag me into doing your chores!
meanings.sent3: My little brother would hag me for candy whenever I had some.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the fly would hag me all day long.
meanings.sent5: The telemarketer continued to hag me with calls even after I said no.

meanings.sent1: Legends speak of hags haunting the old castle ruins.
meanings.sent2: The hag appeared in the traveler's nightmares, warning of danger.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous hag played pranks on unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent4: The hag's eerie presence sent shivers down the villagers' spines.
meanings.sent5: The ancient hag was said to have powers beyond human understanding.
